item.title: 武器需求强劲，诺斯罗普-格鲁曼公司上调 2025 年利润预期
item.description: 诺斯罗普-格鲁曼公司（Northrop Grumman）周二上调了年度利润预期，押注在地缘政治紧张局势加剧之际对其军用飞机和防御系统的持续需求。【原文：Northrop Grumman raised its annual profit forecast on Tuesday, betting on sustained demand for its military aircraft and defense systems as geopolitical tensions simmer.】

item.title: 由于北美钻井需求疲软，哈里伯顿季度利润下降
item.description: 油田服务公司哈里伯顿周二报告，受北美需求疲软的影响，第二季度利润下降。【原文：Oilfield services firm Halliburton reported a fall in profit for the second quarter on Tuesday, hurt by weak North America demand.】

item.title: D.R.霍顿第三季度业绩高于预期，得益于激励机制的推动
item.description: 本周二，D.R. Horton 公布的第三季度利润和收入均高于预期，原因是在高利率和成本上升的情况下，购房者激励措施支撑了房屋销售，使得该房屋建筑商的股价在收盘前上涨了 5.7%。【原文：D.R. Horton reported third-quarter profit and revenue above estimates on Tuesday as buyer incentives sustained home sales amid high interest rates and rising costs, sending shares of the homebuilder up 5.7% before the bell.】

item.title: 甲骨文与 OpenAI 将为星际之门合资企业增加 4.5 千兆瓦的数据中心容量
item.description: ChatGPT开发商甲骨文和OpenAI周二表示，云计算公司Oracle和OpenAI计划开发4.5千兆瓦的额外数据中心容量。【原文：Cloud firm Oracle and OpenAI plan to develop 4.5 gigawatts of additional data center capacity, the ChatGPT developer said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美股期货下跌，财报和关税谈判成为焦点
item.description: 华尔街期货周二走低，原因是投资者准备迎接繁忙的财报日，同时还要应对美国与主要合作伙伴贸易谈判的不确定性。【原文：Wall Street futures edged lower on Tuesday as investors braced for a busy day of earnings while navigating uncertainties around U.S. trade negotiations with key partners.】

item.title: 早间竞标市场异常平静
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 特朗普关税使通用汽车盈利减少 10 亿美元
item.description: 本周二，通用汽车公司第二季度核心利润下降 32%，降至 30 亿美元，原因是该汽车制造商继续面临具有挑战性的关税政策，该公司称，关税政策使其业绩减少了 11 亿美元。【原文：General Motors' second-quarter core profit fell 32% to $3 billion on Tuesday, as the automaker continued to confront challenging tariff policies, which it said sapped $1.1 billion from the results.】

item.title: 印度 Paytm 第一季度实现盈利
item.description: 印度 Paytm 周二公布了季度盈利报告，主要得益于强劲的贷款业务和严格控制的支出。【原文：India's Paytm reported a quarterly profit on Tuesday aided by strong lending business and as it kept a tight lid on expenses.】

item.title: 市场--"短暂 "通胀的幽灵如何萦绕着利率辩论
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）的顾问约瑟夫-拉沃格纳（Joseph Lavorgna）认为，关税不会导致通货膨胀，并称那些一直预测唐纳德-特朗普总统的进口关税会导致物价上涨的经济学家是错误的。【原文：Joseph Lavorgna, counselor to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, believes tariffs are not inflationary and says economists who have been predicting that prices would rise due to President Donald Trump’s import duties are wrong.】

item.title: 人工智能竞争对手加强竞争，Alphabet 将寻求让投资者放心
item.description: 面对来自人工智能竞争对手的前所未有的威胁，Alphabet 本周将热切地向投资者保证，公司在人工智能技术上的投入正在帮助其在搜索和广告业务上挖掘更深的护城河。【原文：Alphabet , faced with unprecedented threats from AI rivals, will be keen to assure investors this week that the company's own spending on the technology is helping it dig a deeper moat around its search and advertising businesses.】

item.title: 独家报道特朗普的金顶公司寻找马斯克 SpaceX 公司的替代者
item.description: 据三位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，由于与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）之间的紧张关系威胁到太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）在该项目中的主导地位，特朗普政府正在扩大寻找合作伙伴的范围，以建造金顶导弹防御系统，并向亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）的库伯项目（Project Kuiper）和大型国防承包商示好。【原文：The Trump administration is expanding its search for partners to build the Golden Dome missile defense system, courting Amazon.com's Project Kuiper and big defense contractors as tensions with Elon Musk threaten SpaceX's dominance in the program, according to three sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Humana 将减少预先授权要求
item.description: Humana 周二表示，它将在 2026 年 1 月 1 日前取消约三分之一的门诊服务预先授权。【原文：Humana said on Tuesday it would eliminate about one-third of prior authorizations for outpatient services by January 1, 2026.】

item.title: 贸易组织称，加拿大抵制美国烈酒损害了更广泛的酒类销售
item.description: 加拿大一家酒类贸易集团周二表示，加拿大各省在与美国的贸易争端中抵制美国烈酒，导致美国进口烈酒以及全国其他进口和国产烈酒的销量急剧下降。【原文：Canadian provinces' boycott of U.S. spirits amid a trade dispute with the United States has caused a sharp drop in sales of American imports, as well as other imported and domestic spirits across the nation, a Canadian liquor trade group said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 市场波动加剧交易热潮，美国交易所将获得意外之财
item.description: 由于投资者急于重新配置受关税波动影响的投资组合，创纪录的交易量带来的手续费收入增加，预计美国主要证券交易所第二季度利润将有所增长。【原文：Major U.S. stock exchanges are expected to report higher second-quarter profits, driven by increased fee collection from record-breaking trading volumes as investors rushed to reposition portfolios hit by tariff-related volatility.】

item.title: 高进口量和夏季需求疲软拖累美国汽油价格
item.description: 今年夏天，美国汽油价格可能在四年多来首次跌破每加仑 3 美元，原因是连续的恶劣天气抑制了燃料需求，而进口量的猛增又填补了库存。【原文：U.S. gasoline prices could fall below $3 a gallon this summer for the first time in over four years as a stretch of bad weather events dampens fuel demand and a jump in imports fills inventories.】

item.title: 英格兰银行贝利称借贷成本上升不仅仅是英国的问题
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）周二表示，英国政府借贷成本的上升与其他国家的上升并不脱节。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said on Tuesday that a rise in British government borrowing costs was not out of line with increases in other countries.】

item.title: 英国法院裁定，惠普被迈克-林奇的遗产和前商业伙伴拖欠超过 9.4 亿美元的债务
item.description: 伦敦高等法院的一名法官周二表示，惠普公司因收购已故迈克-林奇及其前商业伙伴的英国软件公司 Autonomy 而被已故迈克-林奇及其前商业伙伴的遗产拖欠 7 亿多英镑（9.44 亿美元）。【原文：Hewlett Packard is owed more than 700 million pounds ($944 million) from the estate of the late Mike Lynch and his former business partner over its acquisition of their British software firm Autonomy, a judge at London's High Court said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 民意调查发现，每四家德国初创企业中就有一家可能因缺乏资金而倒闭
item.description: 周二公布的一项研究显示，由于担心欧洲最大经济体经济放缓会影响获得风险投资的前景，德国每四家科技初创企业中就有一家考虑离开德国。【原文：One in four tech startups in Germany is considering leaving the country due to concerns that an economic slowdown in Europe's largest economy was weighing on prospects for securing venture capital, a study released on Tuesday showed.】

item.title: 美国初创企业 xLight 募集 4000 万美元，与中国争夺关键芯片制造激光器
item.description: 硅谷初创公司 xLight 已融资 4000 万美元，旨在制造新型激光器的首台原型机，这种激光器可能会撼动全球芯片产业，并重新夺回美国在这一领域的领先地位，而中国正在积极投资这一领域。【原文：Silicon Valley startup xLight has raised $40 million, aiming to build the first prototype of a new class of laser that could shake up the global chip industry and reclaim U.S. leadership in a field that China is aggressively investing in.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，比亚迪将推迟匈牙利新工厂的量产时间，并减少电动汽车的产量
item.description: 两位熟知内情的消息人士称，中国比亚迪在匈牙利新建的电动汽车工厂将推迟到2026年才开始大规模生产，至少在头两年将以低于产能的速度运营。【原文：China's BYD will delay mass production at its new electric vehicle factory in Hungary until 2026 and will run the plant at below capacity for at least the first two years, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 日本对中国台湾不锈钢板发起反倾销调查
item.description: 日本贸易部和财政部周二表示，日本已对从中国大陆和台湾进口的镍基不锈钢冷轧钢板和钢带发起反倾销调查。【原文：Japan has launched an anti-dumping investigation into nickel-based stainless cold-rolled steel sheets and strips imported from China and Taiwan, its trade and finance ministries said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 印尼官员称新人工智能路线图瞄准外商投资
item.description: 印尼一位官员表示，印尼将于下月完成首个人工智能国家战略的制定工作，以吸引外资，这个东南亚最大的经济体希望加入全球人工智能和芯片制造竞赛。【原文：Indonesia will finish work next month on its first national strategy on artificial intelligence in a bid to attract foreign investment, an official said, as Southeast Asia's largest economy looks to join the global AI and chip-making race.】

item.title: 消息人士称印美临时贸易协议前景黯淡
item.description: 两名印度政府消息人士称，由于谈判仍在削减关键农产品和乳制品关税问题上陷入僵局，印度和美国在华盛顿8月1日最后期限前达成临时贸易协议的前景已经暗淡。【原文：The prospects of an interim trade deal between India and the United States before Washington's August 1 deadline have dimmed, as talks remain deadlocked over tariff cuts on key agricultural and dairy products, two Indian government sources said.】

item.title: 销量下滑，俄罗斯顶级汽车制造商 Avtovaz 可能缩短每周工作时间
item.description: 俄罗斯最大的汽车制造商 Avtovaz 周二表示，由于高利率和来自中国的竞争挤压了其销售额，该公司可能将每周工作时间从五天缩短为四天，这是一家大型国有企业罕见的举动。【原文：Russia's largest carmaker Avtovaz on Tuesday said it may shorten its working week to four from five days, a rare move from a major state-owned employer, as high interest rates and competition from China squeeze its sales.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，贝莱德限制在中国旅行时使用公司设备
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引一份内部备忘录报道，贝莱德公司（BlackRock）已告知前往中国出差的员工使用临时借用的电话，不要携带公司的笔记本电脑，这凸显了一些全球性公司对在中国工作的员工日益增长的担忧。【原文：BlackRock has told staff traveling to China for business trips to use temporary loaner phones and not to bring company laptops, underscoring growing concern among some global firms about employees working there, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing an internal memo.】

item.title: 工业修剪不会像上次那样迅速使中国摆脱通货紧缩
item.description: 中国针对生产商之间价格战的强硬言论，让人们预期中国政府可能即将启动工业产能削减，这是一场期待已久但极具挑战性的反通货紧缩运动，会给经济增长带来风险。【原文：China's hardened rhetoric against price wars among producers is raising expectations Beijing may be about to kick off industrial capacity cuts in a long-awaited, but challenging, campaign against deflation that carries risks to economic growth.】

item.title: 洛杉矶时报》老板宋世雄表示，《洛杉矶时报》将上市
item.description: 洛杉矶时报》的所有者帕特里克-宋（Patrick Soon-Shiong）周一在接受电视采访时表示，《洛杉矶时报》计划在明年内上市，努力让公众拥有这份拥有 143 年历史的出版物。【原文：The Los Angeles Times newspaper plans to go public within the next year, its owner Patrick Soon-Shiong said in a television interview on Monday, in an effort to give the public ownership of the 143-year-old publication.】

item.title: 瑞士莲因消费者忠诚度和对高档巧克力的喜好而上调增长预期
item.description: 瑞士巧克力制造商瑞士莲（Lindt & Spruengli）周二上调了对2025年有机销售增长的预期，理由是消费者忠诚度提高以及更多高档产品的趋势。【原文：Swiss chocolate maker Lindt & Spruengli raised its organic sales growth forecast for 2025 on Tuesday, citing consumer loyalty and a trend towards more premium products.】

item.title: 泰国内阁任命维泰-拉塔纳功为下一任央行行长
item.description: 泰国内阁周二批准威泰-拉塔纳功（Vitai Ratanakorn）接任下一任央行行长，并在货币政策空间有限的情况下重振低迷的经济。【原文：Thailand's cabinet gave its approval on Tuesday for Vitai Ratanakorn to take over as the next central bank governor and revive an economy in the doldrums with limited monetary policy room to work with.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，摩根大通考虑提供由客户持有的加密货币支持的贷款
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周二援引知情人士的话报道称，摩根大通正在探索最早于明年提供由客户持有的加密货币（包括比特币和以太币）支持的贷款的计划。【原文：JPMorgan Chase is exploring plans to offer loans backed by clients' cryptocurrency holdings, including bitcoin and ethereum, as early as next year, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】
